block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com, or by mail to Westchester Cultural Calendar, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.
COMEDY
Kingston Rob Bartlett, comedian. April 28 at 8 p.m. $40 and $50. Ulster Performing Arts Center, 601 Broadway. (845) 473-2072.
Peekskill Lewis Black, stand-up. Friday at 8 p.m. Sold out. Paramount Center for the Arts, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.
FILM

Purchase French Film Festival: ''L'Enfant (The Child),'' directed by Jean-Pierre and Luc Dardenne; in French with English subtitles. April 22 at 7 p.m. ''The Beat That My Heart Skipped (De battre mon coeur s'est arrêté),'' directed by Jacques Audiard; in French with English subtitles. April 29 at 7 p.m.; rescheduled due to weather. Both free. Music Building, Manhattanville College, 2900 Purchase Street. (914) 323-5407.
FOR CHILDREN

Bronx Family art project, with flower and leaf prints. Through April 22. Free with admission: $2 and $4. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Wave Hill, 675 West 252nd Street. (718) 549-3200.
Croton-on-Hudson ''The Complete Works of Shakespeare (Abridged),'' comedy presented by M and M productions. Friday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Croton Free Library, 171 Cleveland Drive. (914) 271-6612.
Larchmont ''The Complete Works of Shakespeare (Abridged),'' comedy presented by M and M productions. April 29 at 4 p.m. Free. Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Avenue. (914) 834-2281.
Mahopac ''Feathers Sometimes Soar on the Breath of God,'' play about Emily Dickinson; presented by M and M productions. April 22 at 2 p.m. Free. Mahopac Public Library, 668 Route 6. (845) 628-2009.
Nyack ''High School Musical,'' presented by the Helen Hayes Youth Theater. Through April 22. $15. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741.
Somers ''Feathers Sometimes Soar on the Breath of God,'' play about Emily Dickinson; presented by M and M productions. April 29 at 2 p.m. Free. Somers Library, Reis Park. (914) 232-1285.
White Plains Tom Chapin, singer-songwriter; family concert. April 22 at 1 and 4 p.m. $18 and $20. White Plains Performing Arts Center, 11 City Place. (914) 328-1600.
Yonkers ''Music and Merriment,'' children's program. Ages 2 to 5. Through June 20. Yonkers Crestwood Library, 16 Thompson Street. (914) 337-1500, Extension 360.

Yonkers ''Mother Goose Time,'' nursery rhymes, stories songs and finger plays. Ages 2 to 4. Through May 17. Free; registration required. Yonkers Public Library, Grinton I. Will branch, 1500 Central Park Avenue. (914) 337-1500.
MUSIC AND DANCE

ANNANDALE-ON-HUDSON Dawn Upshaw, soprano, with Gilbert Kalish, pianist; benefit recital for The Bard College Conservatory of Music. Friday at 7 p.m. $25 to $80. Fisher Center for the Performing Arts, Bard College, (845) 758-7900.
Armonk Sean Grace, Celtic music. Friday at 8 p.m. $10 and $15. Whipporwill Hall, 19 Whippoorwill East. (914) 273-3887.
Irvington Lucy Kaplansky, folk. Friday at 8 p.m. $30. Irvington Town Hall, 85 Main Street. (914) 591-6602.
Nyack Southside Johnny and the Asbury Dukes, with Joe D'Urso and Stone Caravan, rock. April 28 at 8 p.m. $40. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741.

Purchase Westchester Philharmonic, classical and jazz music by Mozart, Ellington and others. Through April 22. $22 to $67; reservations required. Purchase Jazz Orchestra. Wednesday at 8 p.m. $10 to $25. Purchase Symphony Orchestra. Friday at 8 p.m. $12 to $20. Sonny Rollins, jazz saxophonist. April 28 at 8 p.m. $15 to $30. Spring dance concert, presented by the Purchase College Conservatory of Dance. Through April 29. $13.50 to $20. Performing Arts Center, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6200.
Rye John Fumasoli and The Jones Factor, big band. Friday at 8 p.m. $10 to $18. Rye Arts Center, 51 Milton Road. (914) 967-0700.
OUTDOORS

Scarsdale ''Earth Day Celebration,'' with refreshments, demonstrations and games. April 22, 1 to 3:30 p.m. Free; registration required. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 9:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Greenburgh Nature Center, 99 Dromore Road. (914) 723-3470.
SPOKEN WORD
Sleepy Hollow Reading by Arthur Phillips and Thrity Umrigar, novelists. April 29 at 4:30 p.m. $3 and $5. Hudson Valley Writers' Center, 300 Riverside Drive. (914) 332-5953.
Yonkers Annual poetry festival, with readings, receptions, book signings and open mikes. Friday through April 29. Free. Heimbold Visual Arts Center, Sarah Lawrence College.
THEATER
Croton Falls ''Crimes of the Heart,'' comedy by Beth Henley. Through May 6. $25 to $29. Schoolhouse Theater, 3 Owens Road. (914) 277-8477.
Larchmont ''You're a Good Man, Charlie Brown,'' presented by the Harrison Players. Friday through April 29. $10 to $16. School of Saints John and Paul, 280 Weaver Street. (914) 937-8427.

Peekskill ''The Pirates of Penzance,'' operetta by Gilbert and Sullivan; benefit for The Franciscan Sisters of the Atonement at Graymoor in Garrison. April 29 at 2 p.m. $21.50. Paramount Center for the Arts, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.

Poughkeepsie Young Playwrights Festival, professional actors and designers stage the work of students from Poughkeepsie Middle School. Friday at 10 a.m. and 7 p.m. $5. Bardavon 1869 Opera House, 35 Market Street. (845) 473-2072.

Purchase ''Our Town,'' drama by Thornton Wilder, presented by the Purchase College Conservatory of Theater. Friday through May 5. $15 to $20. Performing Arts Center, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6200.
Sleepy Hollow Live short radio plays presented by Andrew Joffe and Ellen Thurston. April 28 at 8 p.m. $10 and $12. Hudson Valley Writers' Center, 300 Riverside Drive. (914) 332-5953.

Yorktown Heights ''Seussical,'' musical by Stephen Flaherty and Lynn Ahrens, adapted from the books by Dr. Seuss; presented by Yorktown Stage. Through April 29. $19 to $25. Yorktown Community and Cultural Center, 1974 Commerce Street. (914) 962-5758.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

Annandale-on-Hudson ''In Someone Else's Skin,'' ''Facts on the Ground'' and ''Stutter and Twitch'' mixed media group exhibitions. Through April 29. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Bard College, Center for Curatorial Studies. (845) 758-7598.

Beacon ''Bau 28: Mud/Bone Studio 889: Encounters with Pablo Neruda,'' mixed media group show. Through May 6. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 6 p.m. Beacon Artists Union (bau), 161 Main Street. (845) 440-7584.

Beacon ''Models on Main Street,'' photography group show. Through June 3. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 6 a.m. to 10 p.m.; Fridays, 6 a.m. to 11 p.m.; Saturdays, 7 a.m. to 11 p.m.; Sundays, 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. Muddy Cup Coffee House, 129 Main Street. (845) 440-8855.
Briarcliff Manor Watercolors by Edward Malsberg. Through May 12. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Images Art Gallery, 1157 Pleasantville Road. (914) 762-3000.
Bronx ''Sugar Buzz,'' mixed-media group show. Through May 15. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m.to 4 p.m. Lehman College Art Gallery, Bedford Park Boulevard West. (718) 960-8731.

Bronx ''Caribbean Gardens: Journey to Paradise,'' plant exhibition and related events. Friday through Sept. 16. $5 to $20. New York Botanical Garden, Bronx River Parkway and Fordham Road. (718) 817-8616.

Bronx ''Emily Dickinson Rendered,'' mixed-media group show of art inspired by the poetry of Emily Dickinson. Through May 25. $2 to $4; members and under 6, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Wave Hill, 675 West 252nd Street. (718) 549-3200.

Bronxville ''A Celebration of Childhood,'' watercolors by Miriam Schulman. Through April 29. Reception: April 29, 1 to 3 p.m. Hours: Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Tuesdays, to 9 p.m.; Thursdays, 1 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 9:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Bronxville Public Library, 201 Pondfield Road. (914) 337-7680.
Croton Falls ''People Who Love People,'' group show. Through May 6. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. The Schoolhouse Gallery, 3 Owens Road. (914) 277-3461.

Cuddebackville Maple syrup pancake breakfast and spring festival, with boat rides and a flea market. April 22, 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. $2.75 and $5. Neversink Valley Area Museum, 26 Hoag Road. (845) 754-8870.

Dobbs Ferry ''From Spain to Avalon,'' mixed-media exhibition. Through May 22. Free. Hours: Sundays through Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. St. Cabrini Nursing Home, 115 Broadway. (914) 693-6800, Extension 522.

Katonah ''Young Artists 2007,'' exhibition by high school students. April 22 through May 6. Admission: $5, $3 for seniors and students. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. (914) 232-9555.

Kingston ''The Door As Art Form'' and ''Portals,'' mixed-media group shows. Through April 28. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 1 to 6 p.m. Arts Society of Kingston Arts Center, 97 Broadway. (845) 338-0331.

Mount Vernon ''Overlooked Hero: John Glover and the American Revolution,'' historical documents and prints; continuing. St. Paul's Church National Historic Site, 897 South Columbus Avenue. (914) 667-4116.

New Paltz ''From Impressionist to Modernist: The Paintings of Woodstock Artist Charles Rosen.'' Through May 20. Free. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Samuel Dorsky Museum of Art, SUNY New Paltz. (845) 257-3844.

New Rochelle ''Byron Goto: A Retrospective,'' mixed-media exhibition. Through June 17. Hours: Tuesdays and Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Thursdays and Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Castle Gallery, 29 Castle Place. (914) 654-5423.

North Salem ''Brush with Nature,'' group exhibition featuring traditional and modern brush painting techniques. Through June 5. Hammond Museum and Japanese Stroll Garden, 28 Deveau Road. (914) 669-5033.

Peekskill ''First Look II,'' mixed media exhibition by art students. Through Sept. 30. Hours: Saturdays, noon to 6 p.m., and by appointment. Hudson Valley Center for Contemporary Art, 1701 Main Street. (914) 788-0100.

Pelham ''Lovely, Dark and Deep: Women Artists Retake the Fairy Tale'': mixed-media group show. Through April 28. Free. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Pelham Art Center, 155 Fifth Avenue. (914) 738-2525.

Port Chester ''East West Fusion,'' recent works by five member artists, with ''Joys of Raku,'' group show. Through April 28. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Clay Art Center, 40 Beech Street. (914) 937-2047.

Purchase ''On The Cusp,'' an instillation by Laurel Garcia Colvin. Through May 12. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. and by appointment. Brownson Gallery, 2900 Purchase Street. (914) 323-5331.

Purchase ''Fugitive Artist: The Early Work of Richard Prince, 1974-77.'' Through June 24. ''Lesley Dill: Tremendous World,'' installations. Through June 3. ''New Media: When,'' group show. Through May 20. $3 to $5; members and children 12 and under, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Neuberger Museum of Art, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6100.

Rye ''Spotlight on Historical Costumes,'' a collection of seasonal costumes. Through June 7. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Square House Museum, 1 Purchase Street. (914) 967-7588.
Tivoli ''The Body Eclectic,'' mixed-media group show. Through April 29. Hours: Fridays, 5 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 1 to 9 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Tivoli Artists Co-op, 60 Broadway. (845) 757-2667.

West Nyack ''A Sequence of Steps,'' photographs by Elizabeth Knowles. ''Jiffy Pop,'' mixed-media group show. Both through April 29. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Rockland Center for the Arts, 27 South Greenbush Road. (845) 358-0877.

A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com, or by mail to Westchester Cultural Calendar, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.
